snippet: A merger of two popular New York tour bus companies violates antitrust law, state and federal lawyers say.
abstract: Federal and New York State governments sue Twin America, joint venture that operates New York City’s popular hop-on, hop-off tour bus service; suit accuses company of being a monopoly and using its dominant position to overcharge customers; company was created in 2009 by the merger of tour bus companies City Sights and Gray Line New York.
lead_paragraph: A merger of two popular New York tour bus companies violates antitrust law, state and federal lawyers say.

headline.seo: Double-Decker Bus Firm, Twin America, Is Accused of Monopolization
headline.main: Firm Is Accused of Monopolizing Double-Decker Bus Trade
headline.print_headline: Firm Is Accused of Monopolizing Double-Decker Bus Trade
